item.title: When Facebook went down this week, traffic to news sites went up
item.description: On August 3, 2018, Facebook went down for 45 minutes. That's a little baby outage compared to the one this week, when, on October 4, Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp were down for more than five hours. Three years ago, the 45-minute Facebook break was enough to get people to go read news elsewhere…

item.title: Helping Apache Servers stay safe from zero-day path traversal attacks (CVE-2021-41773)
item.description: On September 29th 2021, the Apache Security team was alerted of a path traversal vulnerability being actively exploited (zero-day) against Apache HTTP Server version 2.4.49. Customers running the affected Apache version, should update to 2.5.51 as soon as possible.
item.author: (Michael Tremante)

item.title: KI ermöglicht Drohnen den Flug ins Unbekannte
item.description: Researchers at the University of Zurich have developed a new approach to autonomously fly quadrotors through unknown, complex environments at high speeds using only on-board sensing and computation. The new approach could be useful in emergencies, on construction sites or for security applications.

item.title: Thoughts on chess improvement, after gaining 600 points in 6 months (1200-1800)
item.description: For some background: I played chess briefly with my friends in high school, where I had a rating of around 1100 online. I gave up the game for about 10 years, then picked it back up again recently, in May. I’ve tried a ton of different approaches in the past 6 months, switching things up whenever I stopped seeing results. I’ve improved from 1238 to 1802, and based on my win rate currently I think I’ve got another 50 points in me before I plateau again.

item.description: Has this ever happened to you? Scrolling through your feed, you notice someone raising a trillion dollars for her company. item.title: A Cool Customer - Futility Closet
item.description: A brewery stored its beer in a cellar some distance from the bottling plant. The cellar was cooled by pipes that circulated a saline solution from a central cooling unit. The main pipe that connected this cooling unit and the cellar happened to pass near the cellar of a retailer. The brewery’s owner eventually discovered that the retailer was using the saline solution to cool his own cellar. He sued the retailer for theft, but the judge ruled, “In accordance with Article 242 of the Criminal Code, theft is the unlawful appropriation of commodities belonging to another party. In the...
